conclusion: Analyze the electric field at the intersection of the diagonals by considering contributions from each charge.
The image shows a square ABCD with side length L. Point charges are placed at the vertices: +q at A and B, and -q at C and D. The diagonals intersect at a point.
The electric field at a point due to a point charge is given by kq/r^2.
The intersection point of the diagonals is equidistant from points A and C (and B and D), with each diagonal being âˆš2L long.
The electric field due to +q at A is 2kq/L^2.
The electric field due to -q at C is -2kq/L^2.
The total electric field at the intersection point is the sum of these two fields: 2kq/L^2 - 2kq/L^2 = 0.
The magnitude of the field due to +q at A is 2kq/L^2.
The electric field strength at the intersection is 2kq/L^2.
